#Text=Belitung
#Text=Belitung ( locally called Belitong , formerly Billiton ) is one of the two main islands of the Bangka-Belitung province in Indonesia .
#Text=While its big brother , Bangka , has developed as an economic center , Belitung generally remains a sleepy island .

#Text=But you may consider that quiet an advantage for a resort destination which can serve as a weekend getaway from the hectic life in Jakarta , or as an alternative to Bali , if it seems too crowded for you .
#Text=Understand
#Text=You might not expect it from the island whose tin mines gave their name to Australian mining giant BHP Billiton , but Belitung is one of the nicest islands in Southeast Asia .
#Text=The island was pretty much asleep , underrated , and was known only for its tin commodity .

#Text=But it ultimately became famous in 2008 after the movie Laskar Pelangi ( Rainbow Troops ) , which was one of Indonesia 's most watched movies , as it portrays the struggling life of some of the island 's poor children in a remote school ... and the unspoiled beauty of its nature .
#Text=A few years coming , resorts are built , beaches are cleaned , and the island ultimately puts itself in the map as a tropical paradise .
#Text=Unlike the infamous Bali , everything is still laid back .
#Text=You 'll barely find nightclubs , party resorts or any obvious signs of Western culture .
#Text=Pristine white sand beaches look out on a turquoise sea filled with great snorkeling and a fantastic display of offshore islands .
#Text=Check out Tanjung Kelayang and Tanjung Tinggi for world class beaches without the hustle and bustle now found at beaches of this caliber anywhere else .
#Text=Natural features include white sand fringed coconut plantations , elaborate granite rock formations and long temporary sand bars as smooth as powdered sugar .
#Text=Offshore islands are a long swim distance from the beach but colorful local fishing boats will take you on an island tour .
#Text=The main town , Tanjung Pandan , is on its west side and has adequate facilities for a small town .
#Text=Climate
#Text=It 's best to visit the island during the dry season as is most other places in Indonesia ( April-September ) .
#Text=The sun shines more often than the rain pours .

#Text=It is less stormy and as a result , the shallow reefs at the outlying islands are clear enough to be snorkeled in and the waves are less ( but still sometimes because of prevailing winds ) choppy during your island hopping cruise .
#Text=Make sure to apply sunscreen even though you are not tanning ( few , if any , tans ) , as the UV index at the beaches is often horrendous and can result in sunburn .
#Text=Cities
#Text=There are two major cities in Belitung on each other side of the island :
#Text=Tanjung Pandan is the largest town and has adequate facilities for a small city .
#Text=There is a museum , a harbor , and a commercial beach
#Text=Manggar is on the east side .
#Text=A city of coffee shops & undisturbed beaches without the giant rocks like its northern counterpart .
#Text=Gantung at the interior east is where the Laskar Pelangi movie was set .
#Text=By plane
#Text=H.A.S. Hananjoeddin Airport ( TJQ Buluh Tumbang Airport ) .
#Text=This is the only airport serving the island .
#Text=Sriwijaya Air , Garuda Indonesia and Citilink will take you from Jakarta in 50 minutes with 6 daily flights .
#Text=Wings Air and Sriwijaya Air connects the island with neighboring Bangka from Pangkalpinang airport twice daily .
#Text=Most flights arrive in the morning , so that you can see ( nearly ) everything the island has to offer and leave by the following day .

#Text=Be aware that seats tend to quickly fill up during a Saturday ( and back to Jakarta on Sunday ) , June and July , days before and after Lebaran ( as most flights to other Indonesian destinations do ) , Chinese New Year and Tomb Sweeping Day ( Ching Ming ) .
#Text=By boat
#Text=Most visitors arriving by ferry come from the neighboring Bangka Island at Pangkalpinang harbor .
#Text=The Express Bahari has 3 classes of service for a range between Rp 200,000 and Rp 400,000 and will take 4-5 hours , depending on weather .
#Text=There is a high risk of cancellation during the rainy season , so plan ahead .
#Text=It is also possible to get on a ferry from Jakarta , Cirebon or Pontianak ( Kalimantan ) , but might take more than 12 hours .
#Text=Get around
#Text=Belitung is small enough - about 4/5 the size of Bali - that more or less any point on the island can be reached in under two hours from Tanjung Pandan .
#Text=As public transportation on the island is hard to find and the only practical way of moving around is by taxi , or rent a car or a motorcycle .
#Text=Expect to be asked for Rp400,000 - Rp600,000 per day ( all inclusive ) for a good car with driver .
#Text=A common and fair deal for both parts is between Rp600,000 and Rp800,000 for the whole weekend including airport drop-off the last morning .
#Text=Keep in mind that with that they have enough for the whole month ; overpaying only causes greed .
#Text=Motorcycle rentals are even easier , typically available for Rp80,000 per day + Rp25,000 for the delivery to the airport ( excluding petrol ) .
#Text=Alternatively , a local can take you aboard an ojek ( motorcycle taxi ) for generally Rp25,000 to the nearest point of attraction .
#Text=The only legal taxi company in the island .
#Text=Claims to have the cheapest fare to everywhere around the island because of their use of meters .
#Text=Drivers are courteous and wear batik brown or orange uniform .
#Text=However the fleet size is small and consequently , it is advisable to book at least 24 hours in advance .
#Text=They also provide a 7-seater rent car that you can pick at the airport only if you call ahead .
#Text=Belitung Car Rental , ☏ +62 878-9647-8835 .
#Text=Registered company that offers airport pickup and dropoff and free rental dropoff to your hotel if you are staying in the main town .
#Text=They also apparently offer insurance , which some other operators do not offer .
#Text=If you do n't want even the slightest hassle , there are a number of tour companies that can take you on a group tour to the whole island , up to a duration of 4 days and 3 nights .
#Text=They will most often provide everything , including transportation , hotel , and meal recommendations .
